title: STEM Experimentation Education Course Utilizing Smartphones

context.prior_knowledge: Basic physics and mathematics knowledge, and proficiency in fundamental smartphone operations
context.additional_context: Experiment-driven learning using free mobile apps in BYOD environments. Develops real-world problem-solving through project-based assessment

learning_goals: Learners can design experiments to measure sound wavelengths and frequencies using smartphone sensors and applications (e.g., Phyphox)
Learners can graph and analyze collected data to mathematically explain STEM principles (correlations between sound waves and vibrations)
Learners can create environmental noise measurement project proposals and develop presentation materials based on mobile experiment results
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
